comments.author: faulkner.steve@gmail.com
comments.creator: faulkner.steve@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

html5 input type="url" with an associated <datalist> does not provide an indication via accessibility APIs that it as a list asscoiated with it.
Suggest adding haspopup state to inputs that have a datalist associated.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.open http://www.html5accessibility.com/tests/datalist.html
2. inspect accessibility info of first input using accprobe or inspect
3. state does not include haspopup
4 inspect accessibility info of second input using accprobe or inspect
5. has haspopup state added using aria-haspopup=true
Actual Results:  
state does not include haspopup

Expected Results:  
state includes haspopup

comments.author: marco.zehe@gmail.com
comments.creator: marco.zehe@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Confirmed! This bug also shows that we're not exposing the datalist at all through a11y APIs.
comments.text: Confirmed! This bug also shows that we're not exposing the datalist at all through a11y APIs.
should be dupe of bug 559766 or bug 559745
comments.creator: surkov.alexander@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: should be dupe of bug 559766 or bug 559745
comments.author: surkov.alexander@gmail.com

comments.text: I think we expose IA2_STATE_SUPPORTS_AUTOCOMPLETION (and certainly will do after bug 559766). Why do you think haspopup is right state here?
comments.creator: surkov.alexander@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: I think we expose IA2_STATE_SUPPORTS_AUTOCOMPLETION (and certainly will do after bug 559766). Why do you think haspopup is right state here?
